full_title: Appendix D: Dark Energy Equation of State
abstract: Derivation of dark energy parameter w0 = -0.8528 from effective dimension formula with ghost coefficient and shadow corrections

equations.description: Ghost coefficient from central charge ratio
Dark energy equation of state parameter

subsections.title: D.4 Simulation Code
paragraphs: Python simulation code implementing the dark energy equation of state derivation from effective dimension.

code_blocks.content:
# derive_d_eff_v12_8.py
C_MATTER = 26   # Matter central charge
C_GHOST = -26   # Ghost central charge
GHOST_COEFFICIENT = np.abs(C_GHOST) / (2 * C_MATTER)  # 0.5

def derive_d_eff(shadow_kuf=0.576152, shadow_chet=0.576152, d_base=12):
    """Calculate effective dimension with ghost contribution."""
    shared_contribution = GHOST_COEFFICIENT * (shadow_kuf + shadow_chet)
    return d_base + shared_contribution  # 12.576

def derive_w0_from_d_eff(d_eff):
    """Dark energy EoS from effective dimension."""
    return -(d_eff - 1) / (d_eff + 1)  # -0.8528

# DESI DR2 comparison: w0 = -0.83 +/- 0.06
# Deviation: 0.38 \sigma

content_blocks.content: The dark energy parameter $w_0 = -0.8528$ emerges from the effective dimension formula with ghost coefficient derivation.

derivation_chain.description: Calculate ghost coefficient from central charge ratio
Compute effective dimension with shadow corrections
Derive equation of state from effective dimension

info_boxes.title: Dark Energy Equation of State
info_boxes.content: The dark energy equation of state parameter w relates pressure to energy density: p = w * rho. For a cosmological constant, w = -1. The PM framework predicts w0 = -0.8528 from geometric considerations.

info_boxes.title: Ghost Coefficient Origin
info_boxes.content: The ghost coefficient gamma = 0.5 arises from the balance between matter central charge (26) and ghost central charge (-26) in the 2T framework, ensuring anomaly cancellation.

info_boxes.title: Shadow Corrections
info_boxes.content: The shadow corrections Shadow_kuf and Shadow_chet (both 0.576152) represent geometric corrections from the TCS G2 manifold compactification, specifically from torsion effects.

derivation_boxes.title: Step-by-Step Derivation: w0 from Effective Dimension
derivation_boxes.content:
Step 1: Ghost Coefficient
The ghost coefficient balances matter and ghost sectors:
gamma = |c_ghost| / (2 * c_matter) = 26 / 52 = 0.5

Step 2: Shadow Corrections
Geometric corrections from G2 compactification:
Shadow_kuf = Shadow_chet = 0.576152

Step 3: Effective Dimension
Including ghost contribution:
d_eff = 12 + gamma * (Shadow_kuf + Shadow_chet)
d_eff = 12 + 0.5 * 1.152304 = 12.576

Step 4: Equation of State
From effective dimension formula:
w0 = -(d_eff - 1) / (d_eff + 1)
w0 = -11.576 / 13.576 = -0.8528

Comparison to Observations:
DESI DR2: w0 = -0.83 +/- 0.06
Deviation: 0.38 sigma (excellent agreement)
